title: Pytorch install problems on clean Windows 7 system using pip
body_html:
Issue description

Installing PyTorch from PIP on a clean Python3.6 system on Windows 7 fails silently. The install succeeds, but torch cannot be imported.

(rl-env) D:>python
Python 3.6.6 (v3.6.6:4cf1f54eb7, Jun 27 2018, 03:37:03) [MSC v.1900 64 bit (AMD6
4)] on win32
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.

import torch
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "", line 1, in
File "D:\rl-env\lib\site-packages\torch_init_.py", line 78, in
from torch._C import *
ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found.

I've traced this problem down to the fact that Pytorch seems to require OpenMp, which is not included in the PIP wheel, so the torch._C load fails because the dependent library libiomp5md.dll is missing. There may be further missing dependencies that I am not able to identify.

A workaround to this problem is to use pytorch from an Anaconda install.

System Info

  • PyTorch or Caffe2: PYTorch
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): pip
  • Build command you used (if compiling from source): N/A
  • OS: Windows 7
  • PyTorch version: 0.40
  • Python version: 3.6.6
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: Tried with no Cuda and with Cuda 9.1
  • GPU models and configuration: Nvidia Tesla K20c
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): N/A
  • CMake version: N/A
  • Versions of any other relevant libraries: N/A

body:
## Issue description

Installing PyTorch from PIP on a clean Python3.6 system on Windows 7 fails silently.    The install succeeds, but torch cannot be imported.

(rl-env) D:\>python
Python 3.6.6 (v3.6.6:4cf1f54eb7, Jun 27 2018, 03:37:03) [MSC v.1900 64 bit (AMD6
4)] on win32
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import torch
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "D:\rl-env\lib\site-packages\torch\__init__.py", line 78, in <module>
    from torch._C import *
ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found.
>>>

I've traced this problem down to the fact that Pytorch seems to require OpenMp, which is not included in the PIP wheel, so the torch._C load fails because the dependent library libiomp5md.dll is missing.   There may be further missing dependencies that I am not able to identify.

A workaround to this problem is to use pytorch from an Anaconda install.   

## System Info

- PyTorch or Caffe2:   PYTorch
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source):  pip
- Build command you used (if compiling from source):  N/A
- OS:  Windows 7
- PyTorch version:  0.40
- Python version:  3.6.6
- CUDA/cuDNN version:   Tried with no Cuda and with Cuda 9.1
- GPU models and configuration:   Nvidia Tesla K20c
- GCC version (if compiling from source):  N/A
- CMake version:  N/A
- Versions of any other relevant libraries:  N/A
